todos.title: Representation
todos.body: XML, JSON, HTML

todos.title: Stateless Service
todos.body: Unaware of any information from a previous request.

todos.title: ACID – Atomacity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability)
todos.body: Transactions are used to ensure that a transaction is complete and consistent.

todos.title: HATEOAS – Hypermedia as the engine of application state
todos.body: The client interacts with applications only through hypermedia (hyperlinks)

todos.title: KPI – Key Performance Indicators
todos.body: Tell if the system is meeting the business goals.

todos.title: Database
todos.body: SQL, NoSQL

todos.title: Programming Languages
todos.body: Ruby, PHP, Python, Node.js

todos.title: BASE – Basically Available, Soft State, Eventually Consistent
todos.body: Resources can fail and the data will eventually become consistent

todos.title: Private, Public, Hybrid Cloud
todos.body: Public cloud shares services with other users.  Private cloud has one user.  Hybrid cloud implements both.

todos.title: Security
todos.body: Protection, Detection, Prevention.

todos.title: Access
todos.body: OAuth, OpenID

todos.title: Content Delivery Network
todos.body: Network of distributed computers to deliver content.

todos.title: Five Characteristics of Cloud Computing
todos.body: Network access, elasticity, resource pooling, measured service, and on-demand self-service.

todos.title: Logging
todos.body: Loggly, Logentries

todos.title: Cloud Bursting
todos.body: Leveraging the cloud to handle peaks in traffic.

todos.title: Four NoSQL Databases
todos.body: Key-Value, Column Store, Document Store, Graph Database

todos.title: Key Management
todos.body: Keys should not be stored in clear text, should be changed every 90 days, should not be stored on the same server they are protecting.

todos.title: Regulations
todos.body: Health Information Portability and Accountability Act, Payment Card Industry Data Security Standards, Private Information Regulation, ISO 27001, FISO, SSAE 16, FedRAMP, ITAR, FIPS.

todos.title: Gartner Hype Cycle
todos.body: Graph and terminology to describe how technology matures over time.

todos.title: Legacy Systems
todos.body: Existing systems.  Legacy systems are tough to migrate to a new cloud.  Systems should be migrated one step at a time.

todos.title: Daas
todos.body: Database as a service.

todos.title: Iaas
todos.body: Buying infrastructure.

todos.title: Saas
todos.body: Buying infrastructure, platforms, and software.

todos.title: Paas
todos.body: Buying infrastructure and platforms (operating systems, databases, middleware).

todos.title: Cloud Providers
todos.body: AWS, RackSpace, GoGrid, Apigee, Mashery, Layer 7, EC2, Apprenda, Azure, OpenStack

todos.title: Stateful
todos.body: Aware of information from a previous request.

todos.title: Scaling Out
todos.body: Adding additional infrastructure that runs along side existing.

todos.title: Scaling Up
todos.body: Adding additional hardware to a stack.

todos.title: Backup
todos.body: Active – Pass Cold, Active – Pass Warm, Active – Pass Hot

todos.title: Encryption
todos.body: 75% of security breaches are inside job.  63% of those breaches were not with intent.

todos.title: Global Cloud Computing Report Card – Business Software Alliance
